page.title: 04FARMING IN CORHAMPTON FOREST
page.content:
Farming in this area is mostly arable. There is a dairy farm, beef cattle and a small number of sheep brought in for winter fattening and a stud farm. Arable crops other than wheat and barley include, oil seed rape for vegetable oil, grass for seed and linseed. Some arable land is devoted to cover crops such as kale and maize, for pheasant shooting. Some very steep fields are under cultivation.Most farms have a large dryer unit for crops.
STRAW DISPOSAL: Through lack of demand for thatching and livestock use, straw has to be disposed of through controlled burning in the fields.It is sad that local authorities and modern villages do not allow for this product to be processed: ground down for feeding stuff or building materials.
